critique: The document is an executive order related to waiving navigation and vessel inspection laws during wartime. As the President, the primary emotion I want to elicit is a sense of confidence and reassurance that the government is taking necessary steps to ensure the successful prosecution of the war. The tone is authoritative and decisive, aiming to convey strength and control. There is an element of surprise in the rapid response following the start of the war. There is no explicit mention of joy, sadness, anger, fear, or disgust, so those scores will be relatively low.
